interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: America's Untold Story DVD
Review Date: 2020/12/27
Store: n/a  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
Product Description: ["America's Untold Story DVD 2017 PG-13 - The first permanent European settlement in the United States was founded two generations before the Pilgrims arrived in 1565. America's Untold Story uncovers the story of America's past that never made it into textbooks."]
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.93 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '4 hours', 'Release date': 'March 20, 2018', 'Studio': 'PBS (Direct)', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: Fascinating series. It’s interesting how this account doesn’t make the history book. I had a friend from St Augustine that would always talk about the city being so old and keeping some Spanish parades to this day. Now I understand why
Review Title: Great historical facts
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Penny Dreadful: The Complete Series
Rory Kinnear  (Actor),     Josh Hartnett  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Boxed Sets
["Some of literature's most terrifying characters, including Dr. Frankenstein and his monster, Dorian Gray, and iconic figures from the novel Dracula are lurking in the darkest corners of Victorian London. They are joined by a core of original characters in a complex, frightening new narrative, where personal demons from the past can be stronger than vampires, evil spirits and immortal beasts. Relive every chilling episode of Showtime's Penny Dreadful if you dare."]
{'Genre': 'Television, Horror/Television', 'Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Eva Green, Harry Treadaway, Rory Kinnear, Reeve Carney, Timothy Dalton, Josh Hartnett, Billie Piper', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '9', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 9.74 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Box set, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '24 hours and 22 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 18, 2017', 'Actors': 'Rory Kinnear, Josh Hartnett, Eva Green, Billie Piper, Harry Treadaway', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '9'}
Excellent series. Really scary, superb acting and scenery. Too bad season 2 was too sexually graphic.
Good series
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Haifaa Al-Mansour'], 'Producers': ['Amy Baer', 'Alan Moloney', 'Ruth Coady'], 'Starring': ['Elle Fanning', 'Maisie Williams', 'Bel Powley'], 'Studio': ['IFC Films']}
This is one of the best movies I have seen in a long time. I had no idea of the inspiration behind Mary Shelley's book Frankestein. It is remarkable how this intellectually gifted woman through life hardships could develop such book and character. Movie offers great depth. The actors are also remarkable
I highly recommend it
{'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Steven Spielberg'], 'Producers': ['Steven Spielberg', 'Amy Pascal', 'Kristie Macosko Krieger'], 'Starring': ['Meryl Streep', 'Tom Hanks', 'Sarah Paulson'], 'Studio': ['20th Century Fox']}
A very self serving account. I read an article from the NY times debating the facts related in the movie. Nevertheless, it is a refreshing story of courage. I guess feminism is in vogue so the movie caters to it. I felt movie was very slow, making a bit boring on some portions.
Not very impressed
Bohemian Rhapsody
Drama, Arts, Entertainment, and Culture, Bold, Electrifying
['Bohemian Rhapsody celebrates the band Queen, their music, and their extraordinary lead singer Freddie Mercury, who defied convention to become one of the most beloved entertainers ever.']
{'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bryan Singer'], 'Producers': ['Graham King', 'Jim Beach'], 'Starring': ['Rami Malek', 'Lucy Boynton', 'Gwilym Lee']}
It is a sanitized version of Mercury's life. Not so accurate based on some reviews but it was great fun to watch. I love Queen's music. I would watch it again
Great movie
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español', 'Português', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Damien Chazelle'], 'Producers': ['Jordan Horowitz', 'Marc Platt', 'Gary Gilbert', 'Fred Berger'], 'Starring': ['Ryan Gosling', 'Emma Stone', 'Amiee Conn'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']}
It was entertaining but not Oscar worthy. I remember musicals like Chicago and the classics: Fred Astaire, Judy Garland and others. This is not one of them
Not Oscar worthy
{'Audio languages': ['Español'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Asghar Farhadi'], 'Producers': ['Alexandre Mallet-Guy', 'Álvaro Longoria'], 'Starring': ['Javier Bardem', 'Penélope Cruz', 'Ricardo Darín']}
The acting from Penelope and her husband is great but the plot is not original. I love the setting in Spain.
Great acting not very original plot
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Damien Chazelle'], 'Producers': ['Damien Chazelle', 'Wyck Godfrey', 'Marty Bowen', 'Isaac Klausner'], 'Starring': ['Corey Stoll', 'Jason Clarke', 'Ciarán Hinds'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']}
This was a great historical account of the first moon landing. I am old enough to remember how unreal it felt. The whole world was riveted. I lived in Southamerica at the time and was just a little girl but I remember my family watching live on TV. Amazing US accomplishment
Great movie
Sully
Drama, Cerebral, Inspiring, Serious
['The story of Chesley Sullenberger, who became a hero after gliding his plane along the water in the Hudson River, saving all of his 155 passengers.']
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Clint Eastwood'], 'Producers': ['Clint Eastwood', 'Frank Marshall', 'Allyn Stewart', 'Tim Moore'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hanks', 'Aaron Eckhart', 'Laura Linney']}
I lived this movie. Tom never disappoints. I could hardly believe that a man of such character who saved the lives of so many with sound judgement was embroiled in a review intended to show a fabricated negligence. Delighted that he was able to probe and defend his decision
Great movie
{'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Cronenberg'], 'Producers': ['Marc Boyman', 'Mel Brooks', 'Stuart Cornfeld', 'Kip Ohman'], 'Starring': ['Jeff Goldblum', 'Geena Davis', 'John Getz'], 'Studio': ['The Walt Disney Studios']}
We watched this old movie with our grandson. Even though it’s old, the plot has sound scientific grounds and the fly evolution is revoltingly credible. Good movie. He loved it
Old but so good
{'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Osgood Perkins'], 'Studio': ['Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM)']}
Horrible characters. Creepy and unauthentic with only aim to shock
Awful
{'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Italiano', 'Español', 'Português', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Français', 'Italiano', 'Português', 'Svenska'], 'Directors': ['Andy Tennant'], 'Producers': ['Robert Cort', 'Rhonda Byrne', 'Paul Hanson', 'Tri-G Films', 'Joe Gelchion', 'Matthew George', 'Robert Katz'], 'Starring': ['Katie Holmes', 'Josh Lucas', "Jerry O'Connell"], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']}
Nice plot but Holmes is not a good actress. Lucas is very nice. But overall a good movie with a good message
Entertaining

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Key Interests:**  
  The user maintains a strong passion for horror and suspense genres, particularly those rooted in classic literature and storytelling. Their interest in biographical dramas continues, with a focus on influential figures and significant historical events emphasizing artistry and cultural significance. They have recently expressed an interest in historical documentaries as a means to uncover lesser-known narratives.

- **Media Format Preference:**  
  They prefer DVD boxed sets for a comprehensive viewing experience.

- **Viewing Preferences:**  
  Enjoys narratives that blend original storytelling with classic horror themes and character depth. They appreciate films with strong scientific foundations and engaging historical narratives, particularly those that resonate emotionally and reflect real-world experiences. They remain critical of narrative pacing and avoid excessive graphic content, while increasingly discerning character authenticity and development.

- **Overall Sentiment:**  
  Delivers constructive feedback, balancing appreciation for artistic merit with critiques on narrative authenticity and character development. They value engaging narratives that convey positive messages, often voicing their aversion to poorly executed plots and underdeveloped characters.

- **Engagement Style:**  
  Engages with media through detailed reviews, emphasizing performance quality, originality, and emotional impact. Their familial connections enrich their viewing experiences, enhancing both enjoyment and engagement with content. They demonstrate a keen interest in historical contexts, particularly those that reveal untold stories.
